Header.forcings: N/A Nat Ant GHG SD SI SA TO SO Oz LU Sl Vl SS Ds BC MD OC AA

experiments.RFDOCn2o: Perturbation from 1850 control using 2014 N2O concentrations
experiments.RFDOCch4: Perturbation from 1850 control using 2014 CH4 concentrations
experiments.NTCFRESPo3: Perturbation: All ozone precursors except methane kept the same as in NTCFRESP-SSP3-7ntcf
experiments.NTCFRESPcntrl: Control: SSP3-7, using SST from NTCFRESP-SSP3-7
experiments.RFDOCbc: Perturbation from 1850 control using 2014 BC emissions
experiments.NTCFRESPnox: Perturbation: All aerosol precursor emissions (but not NOx) as in NTCFRESP-SSP3-7ntcf
experiments.NTCFRESPo3ch4: Perturbation: All ozone precursors kept the same as in NTCFRESP-SSP3-7ntcf
experiments.HISTsstghg: Historical WMGHG concentrations and halocarbons emissions, 1850 tropospheric ozone precursors  emissions
experiments.FDBCKfire: 1850 control with doubled emissions of fires
experiments.RFDOCntcf: Perturbation from 1850 control using 2014 aerosol and ozone precursor emissions (all aerosols interact with radiation)
experiments.HISTghgntcf: Transient historical GHG-only + NTCF precursors (aerosols radiatively active)
experiments.NtcfrespSsp37: Reference: SSP3-7 (to be performed under ScenarioMIP)
experiments.NtcfrespSsp37ntcf: Perturbation: SSP3 with reduced NTCF (aerosol and tropospheric ozone precursors, including methane)
experiments.RFDOCnox: Perturbation from 1850 control using 2014 Nox emissions
experiments.WMFORCch4: Same as CMIP6 historical but with CH4 at 1850
experiments.FDBCKdms: 1850 control with doubled emissions of DMS
experiments.FDBCKvoc: 1850 control with doubled emissions of biogenic VOCs
experiments.FDBCKnox: 1850 control with doubled emissions of lightning Nox
experiments.RFDOCcntrl: Perturbation from 1850 control using 1850 aerosol and ozone precursor emissions (all aerosols interact with radiation)
experiments.HISTsstghgntcf: Transient historical GHG-only + NTCF precursors (aerosols radiatively active)
experiments.RFDOCo3: Perturbation from 1850 control using 2014 aerosol and ozone precursor emissions (only ozone (trop+strat) interact with radiation)
experiments.HISTghg: Historical WMGHG concentrations and halocarbons emissions, 1850 NTCF emissions
experiments.LuNtcf: Time slice at 2050 and/or 2090 for SSP1 and SSP3 to test emissions variations with high and low Land Use emissions (dust/N2O/soil NO/NH3/Fires/CH4)- land use change experiment under LUMIP with AerChemMIP diagnostics
experiments.HISTghgntcfhc1950: Historical WMGHG concentrations and NTCF emissions, 1950 halocarbons, start 1950
experiments.NTCFRESPbc: Perturbation: Only black carbon emissions as in NTCFRESP-SSP3-7ntcf
experiments.WMFORCn20: Same as CMIP6 historical but with N2O at 1850
experiments.RFDOCcovoc: Perturbation from 1850 control using 2014 CO/VOC emissions
experiments.FDBCKss: 1850 control with doubled sea salt emissions
experiments.HISTsstghgntcfhc1950: Historical WMGHG concentrations and NTCF emissions, 1950 halocarbons
experiments.FDBCKch4: 1850 control with doubled emissions of wetlands CH4
experiments.RFDOCods: Perturbation from 1850 control using 2014 ODSs concentrations
experiments.HISTsstghgntcf1850: Historical WMGHG concentrations and halocarbons emissions, 1850 NTCF emissions
experiments.esm1pccouNdep: Fully-coupled specified concentration simulation in which CO2 increases at a rate of 1% per year until quadrupling, plus an additional scenario of anthropogenic nitrogen deposition
experiments.esm1pcbgc: Biogeochemically-coupled specified concentration simulation in which CO2 increases at a rate of 1% per year until quadrupling
experiments.Esmssp585extbgc: Emission-driven future scenario simulation extension to 2300 biogeochemically-coupled
experiments.esm1pcrad: Radiatively-coupled specified concentration simulation in which CO2 increases at a rate of 1% per year until quadrupling
experiments.esm1pcbgcNdep: Biogeochemically-coupled specified concentration simulation in which CO2 increases at a rate of 1% per year until quadrupling, plus an additional scenario of anthropogenic nitrogen deposition
experiments.aqua4xCO2: As CMIP5/CFMIP-2.  Aquaplanet experiment where SSTs are held at control values and the CO2 seen by the radiation scheme is quadrupled.
experiments.sstPi: Same as standard amip experiment, but with monthly-varying SSTs and sea-ice taken from a segment of each model's own piControl run.
experiments.amip4xCO2: As CMIP5/CFMIP-2.  AMIP experiment where SSTs are held at control values and the CO2 seen by the radiation scheme is quadrupled.
experiments.offlwamip4K: As CMIP5/CFMIP-2 amip4K experiment, but with cloud-radiative effects switched off in the LW radiation code.
experiments.offlwaquaControl: As CMIP5/CFMIP-2 aquaControl experiment, but with cloud-radiative effects switched off in the LW radiation code.
experiments.aqua4K: As CMIP5/CFMIP-2.  Aquaplanet experiment where SSTs are subject to a uniform warming of 4K.
experiments.aquaControl: As CMIP5/CFMIP-2.  Aquaplanet (no land) experiment with no seasonal cycle forced with specified zonally symmetric SSTs.
experiments.sstPiFuture: Same as sstPi but a seasonally varying monthly mean climatology of the SST pattern anomaly taken from years 91-140 of each model's own abrupt4xCO2 minus piControl is scaled to have a global mean increase of 4K and applied.
experiments.offlwamip: As CMIP5/CFMIP-2 amip experiment, but with cloud-radiative effects switched off in the LW radiation code.
experiments.amipPiForcing: Identical to standard AMIP experiment but from 1870-present with constant pre-industrial forcing levels (anthro & natural)
experiments.sstPi4xCO2Veg: Same as sstPi but CO2 is quadrupled. The increase in CO2 is seen by both the radiation scheme and vegetation.
experiments.Abrupt05xco2: Identical to the DECK abrupt4xCO2, but at 0.5xCO2
experiments.amipMinus4K: AMIP experiment where SSTs are subject to a uniform cooling of 4K.
experiments.abruptSp4: Conceptually similar to abrupt 4xCO2 DECK experiment, except that the solar constant (not CO2) is abruptly increased by 4%.
experiments.abruptSm4: Same as above, except solar constant is reduced by 4%
experiments.offlwaqua4K: As CMIP5/CFMIP-2 aqua4K experiment, but with cloud-radiative effects switched off in the LW radiation code.
experiments.amip: This CFMIP amip experiment is the same as the DECK amip experiment, but will contain any additional outputs which are required as control variables for the amip4K, amip4xCO2, amipFuture and amipMinus4K experiments which are not included in the AMIP DECK experiment.  This experiment will not be required if all of the proposed CFMIP variables are included in the AMIP DECK Experiment.
experiments.amipTot: Same as amip, but the SST pattern anomaly climatology from sstPiFuture is applied, scaled to have a global mean increase of 4K. CO2 is quadrupled, and the increase in CO2 is seen by both the radiation scheme and vegetation.
experiments.sstPi4xCO2: Same as sstPi but CO2 as seen by the radiation scheme is quadrupled.
experiments.sstPiTot: As sstPiFuture, but CO2 is quadrupled, and the increase in CO2 is seen by both the radiation scheme and vegetation.
experiments.amip4K: As CMIP5/CFMIP-2.  AMIP experiment where SSTs are subject to a uniform warming of 4K.
experiments.sstPi4K: Same as sstPi but with SSTs uniformly increased by 4K
experiments.amipFuture: As CMIP5/CFMIP-2.  AMIP experiment where SSTs are subject to a composite SST warming pattern derived from coupled models, scaled to a global mean of 4K.
experiments.abrupt2xCO2: Identical to the DECK abrupt4xCO2, but at 2xCO2
experiments.histSOL: Historical solar-only transient simulation using  settings from CMIP6 historical simulation but fixed GHG&ODS (1850 level)
experiments.ssp245GHG: *  Extension of well-mixed GHG-only run under SSP2-4.5. *  Models with interactive chemistry schemes should either turn off the chemistry or use a preindustrial climatology of stratospheric and tropospheric ozone in their radiation schemes.
experiments.histALL: * Enlarging ensemble size of the CMIP6 hisorical simulations (2015-2020 under SSP2-4.5 of ScenarioMIP) to at least three members. * DCPP: DCPP proposes a 10 member ensemble of histALL up to 2030 also extended with SSP2-4.5. * Please provide output data up to 2014 as 'CMIP6 historical' and 2015-2020 (or 2030 for DCPP) as SSP2-4.5 of ScenarioMIP.
experiments.ssp245AER: Extension of aerosol-only run under SSP2-4.5
experiments.HistallEstaer2: Historical ALL forcing run with alternate estimates of aerosol concentrations/emissions
experiments.HistallEstnat2: Historical ALL forcing run with alternates estimate of solar and volcanic forcing
experiments.histSOZ: * Historical stratospheric-ozone-only. *  In models with coupled chemistry, the chemistry scheme should be turned off, and the simulated ensemble mean monthly mean 3D stratospheric ozone concentrations from the histALL simulations should be prescribed. Tropospheric ozone should be fixed at 3D long-term monthly mean piControl values, with a value of 100 ppbv ozone concentration in this piControl climatology used to separate the troposphere from the stratosphere. * In models without coupled chemistry the same stratospheric ozone prescribed in histALL should be prescribed. Stratospheric ozone concentrations will be provided by CCMI.
experiments.HistaerHistaerchem: *  Historical anthropogenic-Aerosols-only run. *  Please select one of two experimental designs for ESMs without (histAER) or with (histAERchem) interactive chemistory shemes (see the proposal for details).
experiments.ssp245SOZ: * Extension of stratospheric-ozone-only run under SSP2-4.5 *   In models with coupled chemistry, the chemistry scheme should be turned off, and the simulated ensemble mean monthly mean 3D stratospheric ozone concentrations from the SSP2-4.5 simulations should be prescribed. Tropospheric ozone should be fixed at 3D long-term monthly mean piControl values, with a value of 100 ppbv ozone concentration in this piControl climatology used to separate the troposphere from the stratosphere. * In models without coupled chemistry the same stratospheric ozone prescribed in SSP2-4.5 should be prescribed. Stratospheric ozone concentrations will be provided by CCMI.
experiments.histGHG: * Historical well-mixed GHG-only run. * Models with interactive chemistry schemes should either turn off the chemistry or use a preindustrial climatology of stratospheric and tropospheric ozone in their radiation schemes.  This will ensure that ozone is fixed in all these simulations, and simulated responses in models with and without coupled chemistry are comparable.
experiments.DcppC2: Mechanisms and predictability of the hiatus and of similar long timescale variations of both signs
experiments.DcppA: Decadal hindcasts begun each year from 1960 to present
experiments.DcppC1: Mechanisms and predictability of the hiatus and of similar long timescale variations of both signs
experiments.DcppC3: Effects of volcanoes on decadal prediction and predictability of forced and internal variability components
experiments.allFAF: 1xCO2 experiment, parallel to piControl, forced over the ocean simultaneously by surface windstress (as in the wind experiment), net heat flux (as in the heat experiment) and net freshwater flux (as in the water experiment) anomalies obtained from the CMIP5 ensemble mean of 1pctCO2 experiments at the time of 2xCO2, using a passive tracer to prevent negative climate feedback on the heat flux applied
experiments.passiveheat: 1xCO2 experiment, parallel to piControl, with a flux of passive tracer added at the ocean surface at the same rate as the surface net heat flux anomaly applied in the FAFMIP heat experiment.
experiments.wind: 1xCO2 experiment, parallel to piControl, forced over the ocean by surface windstress anomalies obtained from the CMIP5 ensemble mean of 1pctCO2 experiments at the time of 2xCO2
experiments.water: 1xCO2 experiment, parallel to piControl, forced over the ocean by surface net freshwater flux anomalies obtained from the CMIP5 ensemble mean of 1pctCO2 experiments at the time of 2xCO2
experiments.heat: 1xCO2 experiment, parallel to piControl, forced over the ocean by surface net heat flux anomalies obtained from the CMIP5 ensemble mean of 1pctCO2 experiments at the time of 2xCO2, using a passive tracer to prevent negative climate feedback on the heat flux applied
experiments.HistIpo: Pacemaker 20th century historical run that includes all forcing as used in CMIP6 Historical Simulation, and the observational historical SST is restored in the tropical lobe of the IPO domain (20oS-20oN, 175oE-75oW). The HadISST data will be used.
experiments.DTIP: The topography of the TIP is modified by setting surface elevations to 500m; to understand the combined thermal and mechanical forcing of the TIP. Same model as DECK.
experiments.HistAmo: Pacemaker 20th century historical run that includes all forcing as used in CMIP6 Historical Simulation, and the observational historical SST is restored in the AMO domain (0o-70oN, 70oW-0o)
experiments.AMIP20C: Extended AMIP run that covers 1850-2014. All natural and anthropogenic historical forcings as used in CMIP6 Historical Simulation will be included. AGCM resolution as CMIP6 Historical Simulation. The HadISST data will be used.
experiments.DHLD: The topography of the highlands in Africa, N. America and S. America TP is modified by setting surface elevations to a certain height (500m).Same model as DECK.
experiments.DtipDsh: Surface sensible heat released at the elevation above 500m over the TIP is not allowed to heat the atmosphere.Same model as DECK.
experiments.G6sulfate: Using equatorial SO2 injection, return the radiative forcing from a background of the ScenarioMIP high forcing to the ScenarioMIP middle forcing.
experiments.G7cirrus: Against a background of the ScenarioMIP high forcing, reduce cirrus cloud optical depth by a constant amount
experiments.G7cirrusSlice1: Time slice at 2020 (ScenarioMIP Tier 1 high forcing scenario + cirrus thinning according to G7cirrus)
experiments.G1ext: Beginning from a preindustrial control run, simultaneously quadruple the CO2 concentration and reduce the solar constant such that the TOA radiative flux remains within +/m0.1 W/m2.
experiments.G6solar: Using solar irradiance reduction, return the radiative forcing from a background of the ScenarioMIP high forcing to the ScenarioMIP middle forcing.
experiments.G1extSlice2: Time slice at 1949 (picontrol) for G1ext to examine radiative forcing of abrupt4xCO2 + G1
experiments.G6Slice1: Time slice at 2020 (ScenarioMIP Tier 1 high forcing scenario)
experiments.G7cirrusSlice2: Time slice at 2100 (ScenarioMIP Tier 1 high forcing scenario + cirrus thinning according to G7cirrus)
experiments.G4solarExt: Using solar irradiance reduction, return the radiative forcing from a background of the ScenarioMIP high forcing overshoot extension (years 2101-2300) to the ScenarioMIP middle forcing.
experiments.G4sulfurExt: Using equatorial SO2 injection, return the radiative forcing from a background of the ScenarioMIP high forcing overshoot extension (years 2101-2300) to the ScenarioMIP middle forcing.
experiments.G4Ssa: Against a background of RCP6.0, a layer of stratospheric aerosols is injected into the lower stratosphere at a rate of 8 Tg SO2 per year.  The distribution of sulfate aerosols will be precomputed and provided to all modeling groups.
experiments.G1extSlice1: Time slice at 1850 (picontrol) for G1ext to examine radiative forcing of abrupt4xCO2
experiments.Coupled: Coupled integrations, at least one with constant 1950's forcing (CTL) and one or more with historic and then RCP4.5 (as in Forced_Atmos_Land, EXP).
experiments.ForcedAtmosLand: Forced global atmosphere-land simulations using SST and sea-ice forcings (using methodology based on Mizuta et al beyond present day), and aerosol concentrations (not emissions) to constrain model spread, with RCP4.5 or similar for the projected forcings
experiments.ForcedAtmosLand2100: Extend Forced_Atmos_land to 2100 with agreed forcings
experiments.Ssp585withism: Future climate from ScenarioMIP SSP5-8.5 simulation that includes interactive ice sheets. Set up would follow the standard SSP5-8.5 experiment, and therefore may first require that the Historical Simulation is performed first with a coupled AOGCM-ISM setting
experiments.1pctCo2withism: Idealized 1%/yr CO2 increase to 4xC02 over 140yrs and kept constant at 4xCO2 for an additional 200 to 400 yrs simulation that includes interactive ice sheets.
experiments.piControlwithism: Pre-industrial control simulation that includes interactive ice sheets.
experiments.Ssp585forcedism: Future climate from standard ScenarioMIP SSP5-8.5 simulation is used to force the ice sheet 'offline'. Set up would follow the standard SSP5-8.5 experiment, and therefore may first require that an 'offline' ice sheet Historical Simulation is performed first.
experiments.1pctCo2forcedism: Idealized 1%/yr CO2 increase to 4xC02 over 140yrs and kept constant at 4xCO2 for an additional 200 to 400 yrs simulation with ice sheets forced 'offline' with DECK 1pctCO2.
experiments.piControlforcedism: Pre-industrial control simulation for 'offline' ice sheets.
experiments.LfmipCa5: Prescribed land conditions 1980-2014 climate; SSTs prescribed
experiments.LfmipRa5: Prescribed land conditions 30yr running mean; SSTs prescribed
experiments.Ssp126wssp37landuse: Additional land use policy sensitivity simulation for low radiative forcing scenario, keep all forcings the same as ScenarioMIP SSP1-2.6 (afforestation scenario), but replace land use from SSP3-7 (afforestation) scenario; concentration-driven
experiments.IdealizedRegDeforest: Paired idealized timeslice control and deforestation experiments for specific regions (tropical, boreal, temperate?, TBD)
experiments.HistNolulcc01: Same as CMIP6 historical but with land cover held at 1850, no human activity; concentration driven
experiments.LandcoverManageLnd: Factorial set of land only experiments with increasingly realistic treatment of land management; derivatives of LMIP-hist (LS3MIP)
experiments.HistNolulcc02: Same as CMIP6 historical but with land cover held at 1850, no human activity; concentration driven
experiments.EsmhistbgcNolulcc: Same as esmhistbgc (C4MIP) but with land cover held at 1850, no human activity; emission-driven
experiments.IdealizedGlobalDeforest: Idealized transient global deforestation with all other forcings held constant
experiments.Esmssp585wssp126landuse: Additional land use policy sensitivity simulation for high radiative forcing scenario, keep all forcings the same as in C4MIP esmssp5-8.5 scenario except use SSP1-2.6 land use; emission driven
experiments.Ssp37wssp126landuse01: Additional land use policy sensitivity simulation for high radiative forcing scenario, keep all forcings the same as ScenarioMIP SSP3-7 (deforestation scenario), but replace land use from SSP1-2.6 (afforestation) scenario; concentration-driven
experiments.HistNolulccLnd: Historical land only simulation with land use held at 1850; no human activity; derivative of LMIP-hist (LS3MIP)
experiments.Ssp37wssp126landuse02: Additional land use policy sensitivity simulation for high radiative forcing scenario, keep all forcings the same as SSP3-7 (deforestation scenario), but replace land use from SSP1-2.6 (afforestation) scenario; concentration-driven
experiments.OmipA: Global ocean - sea-ice coupled experiment forced with the Coordinated Ocean - ice Reference Experiments inter-annually varying atmopsheric data sets for the 1948-2009 period. The 62-year forcing period is repeated for no less than 5 cycles.
experiments.OmpiB: Same as the OMIP experiment except that it is not initialized with observed climatologies; rather it is initialized with results from at least a 1000-year spin up of the coupled physical-biogeochemical models. Also it includes radiocarbon to evaluate deep-ocean circulation.
experiments.PdrFull01: Changes in precipitation from various drivers of climate change. Dedicated simulations with CO2, CH4, solar irradiance changes and different aerosol types, to investigate the degree of difference in mean and extreme precipitation between the drivers. Combination of slab ocean/full ocean and fixed SST. Also, perturb aerosols regionally, to investigate the precipitation impact of the longitudinal shift in aerosol loading across models.
experiments.midHolocene: main forcings : trace gases, orbital parameters, dust
experiments.LIG: main forcings : orbital parameters, ice-sheet, trace gases
experiments.past1000: main forcings : trace gases, volcanoes, solar variability, land use
experiments.PlioExp: main forcings : trace gases, orography, ice-sheet
experiments.lgm: main forcings : ice-sheet; trace gases, orbital parameters dust (forcing, or feedback if dust cycle represented in model)
experiments.RfmipHistNat: Prescribed anthropogenic aerosol optical properties. Natural forcings.
experiments.RfmipErfPiCntrl: 30-year atmosphere only integration using preindustrial conditions. Interactive vegetation
experiments.RfmipErfGhg: As in RFMIP-ERF-PI-Cntrl but with present-day greenhouse gases
experiments.RfmipHistAmip: Prescribed anthropogenic aerosol optical properties, prescribed time-varying SSTs
experiments.RfmipErfHistnat: Time-varying forcing from volcanos, solar variability, etc. SST and sea ice fixed at preindustrial control. Interactive vegetation
experiments.RfmipHistAer: Prescribed anthropogenic aerosol optical properties. Changes in aerosols only.
experiments.RfmipHistAmipNudged: Prescribed anthropogenic aerosol optical properties, prescribed time-varying SSTs, winds nudged to reanalysis
experiments.RfmipIrfCo2: Offline radiation calculations varying CO2 from 0.5x to 8x PI values
experiments.RfmipErfHistghg: Time-varying forcing by GHGs. SST and sea ice fixed at preindustrial control. Interactive vegetation
experiments.RfmipErfHistall: Time-varying forcing. SST and sea ice fixed at preindustrial control. Interactive vegetation
experiments.RfmipErfAerx01: As in RFMIP-ERF-AER but with present-day changes scaled by 0.1
experiments.RfmipIrfIndgas: Offline radiation calculations varying one greenhouse gas at a time.
experiments.RfmipErfAnthro: As in RFMIP-ERF-PI-Cntrl but with present-day anthropogenic forcing (greenhouse gases, aerosols and land-use)
experiments.RfmipIrfAer: Request for specialized diagnostics: Full snapshots of spectrally-resolved aerosol optical properties for single days at PI and PD, along with model-specific direct aerosol IRF.
experiments.RfmipErfHistaer: Time-varying forcing by aerosols. SST and sea ice fixed at preindustrial control. Interactive vegetation
experiments.RfmipIrfGhgBase: Offline radiation calculations with specified surface and atmospheric conditions. No clouds or aerosols.
experiments.RfmipErfLu: As in RFMIP-ERF-PI-Cntrl but with present-day land use
experiments.RfmipErfAerx2: As in RFMIP-ERF-AER but with present-day changes scaled by 2
experiments.RfmipErfAer: As in RFMIP-ERF-PI-Cntrl but with with present-day aerosols and ozone
experiments.RfmipHistFixedsst: Prescribed anthropogenic aerosol optical properties. All forcings.
experiments.RfmipHistAll: Prescribed anthropogenic aerosol optical properties. All forcings.
experiments.Ssp126Over: 21st century overshoot scenario relative to SSP1_26. Specific design to be finalized with IAM groups within next several months.
experiments.Ssp126Ext: Extension of SSP1_26 to 2300, in style of CMIP5 extension. Extends negative emissions level reached in 2100 to produce slowly declining forcing.
experiments.Ssp58501: Future scenario with high radiative forcing by the end of century. Following approximately RCP8.5 global forcing pathway but with new forcing based on SSP5. Concentration-driven.
experiments.Ssp126: Future scenario with low radiative forcing by the end of century. Following approximately RCP2.6 global forcing pathway but with new forcing based on SSP1. Concentration-driven.
experiments.Sspx60: Future scenario with medium radiative forcing by the end of century. Following approximately RCP4.5 global forcing pathway but with new forcing based on SSP. Concentration-driven.
experiments.Ssp58502: Future scenario with high radiative forcing by the end of century. Reaches about 7.0 W/m2 by 2100; fills gap in RCP forcing pathways between 6.0 and 8.5 W/m2. Concentration-driven.
experiments.Ssp585Ext: Extension of SSP5_85 to 2300, in style of CMIP5 extension. Assumes emissions eventually decline from 2100 levels to produce stabilized forcing by 2300.
experiments.Ssp585Over: Extension of SSP5_85 to 2300. Assumes emissions decline linearly from 2100 to SSP1_26 levels by 2200, which is expected to produce substantial overshoot in radiative forcing.
experiments.Sspx45: Future scenario with low radiative forcing by the end of century. Reaches about 3.7 W/m2 by 2100; fills gap in RCP forcing pathways between 4.5 and 2.6 W/m2. Concentration-driven.
experiments.Ssp437: Additional ensemble members for future scenario with high radiative forcing by the end of century.Reaches about 7.0 W/m2 by 2100; fills gap in RCP forcing pathways between 6.0 and 8.5 W/m2. Concentration-driven.
experiments.Ssp370: Future scenario with medium radiative forcing by the end of century. Following approximately RCP6.0 global forcing pathway but with new forcing based on SSP. Concentration-driven.
experiments.Solaronly: Historical solar-only transient simulation using  settings from CMIP6 historical simulation but fixed GHG&ODS (1850 level)
experiments.futureSolarMin: Future simulation using solar forcing running into a new Dalton/Maunder Minimum type
experiments.NRLSens: sensitivity experiment using a different spectral solar irradiance (NRLSSI) forcing than the CMIP6 historical simulation
experiments.VolLongC19thC: Early 19th century cluster of strong tropical volcanic eruptions, including the 1809 event of unknown location, and the 1815 Tambora and 1835 Cosigueina eruptions.
experiments.VolShort20EQsurf: As VolShort20EQfull, but with prescribed surface cooling patterns or net  surface flux changes. Complimentary experiment to VolShort20EQstrat.
experiments.VolShort20EQslab: As VolShort20EQfull, but with a slab ocean
experiments.VolLongS100EQ: Idealized equatorial eruption corresponding to an initial emission of 100 Tg of SO2. This eruption has a magnitude roughly corresponding to the 1815 Tambora eruption, the largest historical tropical eruption, which was linked to the so-called 'year without a summer' in 1816
experiments.VolShort20EQfull: 1991 Pinatubo forcing as used in the CMIP6 historical simulations.  Requires special diagnostics of parameterized and resolved wave forcings, radiative and latent heating rates. A large number of ensemble members is required to address internal atmospheric variability.
experiments.VolShort20EQstrat: As VolShort20EQfull, but with prescribed aerosol heating rates in the stratosphere. Complimentary experiment to VolShort20EQstrat.
experiments.Volshort20eqiniDcppC21: As VolShort20EQfull, but as decadal prediction runs. Joint experiment with DCPP, forcing input and implementation of the forcing fully comply with the VolMIP protocol
experiments.VolLongS100HL: Idealized high-latitude (60oN) eruption emitting 100 Tg of SO2 over five months. The eruption's strength and length roughly correspond to that of the 1783-84 Laki eruption.

hybrid_height.z_bounds_factors: a: lev_bnds b: b_bnds orog: orog
hybrid_height.z_factors: a: lev b: b orog: orog

smooth_level.z_bounds_factors: a: a_bnds b1: b1_bnds b2: b2_bnds ztop: ztop zsurf1: zsurf1 zsurf2: zsurf2
smooth_level.z_factors: a: a b1: b1 b2: b2 ztop: ztop zsurf1: zsurf1 zsurf2: zsurf2

alternate_hybrid_sigma.z_bounds_factors: ap: ap_bnds b: b_bnds ps: ps
alternate_hybrid_sigma.z_factors: ap: ap b: b ps: ps

standard_sigma.z_bounds_factors: ptop: ptop sigma: lev_bnds ps: ps
standard_sigma.z_factors: ptop: ptop sigma: lev ps: ps

standard_hybrid_sigma.z_bounds_factors: p0: p0 a: a_bnds b: b_bnds ps: ps
standard_hybrid_sigma.z_factors: p0: p0 a: a b: b ps: ps

p0.long_name: vertical coordinate formula term: reference pressure

clt.comment: For the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.

mrro.cell_measures: time: mean area: mean where land
mrro.comment: 'the total runoff (including ''drainage'' through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell.'

mrsos.cell_measures: time: point area: mean where land
mrsos.long_name: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
mrsos.comment: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface soil layer.

pr.comment: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases from all types of clouds (both large-scale and convective)

prc.comment: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.

prsn.comment: at surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase

ps.comment: surface pressure, not mean sea level pressure

tslsi.long_name: Surface Temperature Where Land or Sea Ice
tslsi.comment: '''skin'' temperature of all surfaces except open ocean.  '

tso.cell_measures: time: point area: mean where sea
tso.comment: temperature of surface of open ocean, sampled synoptically.

uas.comment: near-surface (usually, 10 meters) eastward component of wind.
